data.title: Turkey has invited Ukraine to build LNG terminal
data.meta_description: Turkey invited Ukraine to participate in the construction of LNG -terminal in its territory.  This was announced by the First Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine...
data.text:
ENERGY

08 September 2012 - 20:23

Turkey has invited Ukraine to build LNG terminal

Turkey invited Ukraine to participate in the construction of LNG -terminal in its territory. This was announced by the First Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine Valeriy Khoroshkovsky in an interview with "The Day."

ENERGY

08 September 2012 - 20:23

Turkey invited Ukraine to participate in the construction of LNG -terminal in its territory.

This was announced by the First Vice Prime Minister of Ukraine Valeriy Khoroshkovsky in an interview with "The Day."

"Turkey has invited Ukraine to join the development of a new terminal in Turkey. Key partners here are the Turkish state company Botas (analog Ukrainian "Naftogaz") and a private company Egagas , with one of the existing LNG -terminal in Turkey, "- said Inter.

He also said that three more are being developed jointly with the Turkish energy projects."The first and key - a partnership in the construction of LNG -terminal at the Black Sea coast of Ukraine (near Odessa - Ed.). We expect that, as part of the investment competition to be held in the next two months, the participants will be and the Turkish company ", - said the deputy prime minister.

As Ukraine, according to him, is actively cooperating with Turkey in exploring for gas transportation from Turkey to Ukraine and Ukraine's participation in the planning of the Azerbaijani-Turkish projectTANAP , which is similar to Nabucco , but is in the process of signing agreements on the establishment of a consortium to implement the project.

Recall that in January 2011, a Memorandum of Understanding in the field of energy between the Ministry of Energy and Coal Industry of Ukraine and the Ministry of Energy and Natural Resources of the Republic of Turkey.
